\title{Loacore : Language and Opinion Analyzer for Comments and Reviews' Documentation}

\chapter{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:introduction}}\label{\detokenize{introduction::doc}}
\sphinxstyleemphasis{This project was originally lead by the NLP research group of the Technichal University of Pereira, Colombia}

The goal of this project is to provide a Python library that allow to easily run language processing analysis such as sentiment analysis or depency tree analysis, specialized in comments and reviews such as hotel and restaurant reviews, movie reviews, products reviews… Thus, the library provide an high level API to run backend Freeling processes or other hard coded processes involving nltk and WordNet corpus for example.

\sphinxstyleemphasis{Still under development}


\chapter{Requirements}
\label{\detokenize{requirements:requirements}}\label{\detokenize{requirements::doc}}

\section{Freeling}
\label{\detokenize{requirements:freeling}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] This project uses an external program, called Freeling, to process language : \sphinxurl{http://nlp.lsi.upc.edu/freeling/}
\item[] Check this page to install Freeling on your computer : \sphinxurl{https://talp-upc.gitbooks.io/freeling-4-1-user-manual/content/installation/apis-linux.html}
\item[] Notice that to use Python API, Freeling needs to be installed from source with the dedicated options as described in documentation. \sphinxstyleemphasis{(Not sure, this needs to be checked.)}
\item[] The folder \sphinxstyleemphasis{/usr/local/} is used as the default Freeling path, because it is the default Freeling installation folder on Linux systems. This path can be set at any moment using {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:loacore.conf.set_freeling_path}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_freeling\_path()}}}}}, on Windows, Linux or MacOS.
\end{DUlineblock}


\section{Database}
\label{\detokenize{requirements:database}}

\subsection{SQlite}
\label{\detokenize{requirements:sqlite}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] The embedded database used to store results is an sqlite database, managed with the sqlite3 Python database API : \sphinxurl{https://docs.python.org/3/library/sqlite3.html}
\item[] The corresponding Python package should already be installed in your Python3 distribution.
\end{DUlineblock}


\subsection{Prebuild DB}
\label{\detokenize{requirements:prebuild-db}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxstyleemphasis{Incomplete section}
\item[] Because the database is quite heavy, it is not included in the GitHub repository. Of course you could build it on your own, but because this process can be quite long prebuild databases can be found there \sphinxstyleemphasis{enter url} with following files:
\end{DUlineblock}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
IMDB

\item {} 
UCI

\end{itemize}


\section{Machine Learning}
\label{\detokenize{requirements:machine-learning}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] Machine learning modules are based on two Python libraries.
\end{DUlineblock}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] Gensim : \sphinxurl{https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/}
\item[] Installation : \sphinxurl{https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/install.html}
\end{DUlineblock}

\item {} 
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] Scikit Learn : \sphinxurl{http://scikit-learn.org/stable/}
\item[] Installation : \sphinxurl{http://scikit-learn.org/stable/install.html}
\end{DUlineblock}

\end{itemize}


\section{Utils}
\label{\detokenize{requirements:utils}}
Package \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{utils}} uses a few graphical modules to show results.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
PrettyTable : \sphinxurl{https://pypi.org/project/PrettyTable/}

\item {} 
Matplotlib : \sphinxurl{https://matplotlib.org/users/installing.html\#linux}

\item {} 
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] Tkinter : \sphinxurl{https://wiki.python.org/moin/TkInter}
\item[] Module used to generate gui to save pdf for example.
\item[] Even if the package should be included in Python distribution, on Linux distributions you might need to install \sphinxstyleemphasis{tk} package through your package manager.
\end{DUlineblock}

\end{itemize}

\index{set\_freeling\_path() (in module loacore.conf)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{configuration:loacore.conf.set_freeling_path}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.conf.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_freeling\_path}}}{\emph{freeling\_path}}{}
Set Freeling path.
Changes are permanent, until the next call to {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:loacore.conf.set_freeling_path}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_freeling\_path()}}}}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{freeling\_path}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html\#term-path-like-object}{path-like object}) \textendash{} 
Absolute path of the folder containing the \sphinxstyleemphasis{freeling} folder.

The path must always be specified in the following format : \sphinxstyleemphasis{/path/to/freeling} .
Python will then automatically format it according to the current OS.


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{set\_lang() (in module loacore.conf)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{configuration:loacore.conf.set_lang}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.conf.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_lang}}}{\emph{user\_lang}}{}
Set default language used in Freeling.

Changes are permanent, until the next call to {\hyperref[\detokenize{configuration:loacore.conf.set_lang}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{set\_lang()}}}}}.

Possible values : ‘as’, ‘ca’, ‘cy’, ‘de’, ‘en’, ‘es’, ‘fr’, ‘gl’, ‘hr’, ‘it’, ‘nb’, ‘pt’, ‘ru’, ‘sl’.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{user\_lang}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Freeling language

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Review}
\label{\detokenize{classes:review}}\index{Review (class in loacore.classes.classes)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.classes.classes.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}{\emph{id\_review}, \emph{id\_file}, \emph{file\_index}, \emph{review}}{}~\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Variables}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_review}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} ID\_Review used id Review table

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_file}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} SQL reference to the corresponding File

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_index}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Index of the Review in referenced File

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{review}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} Review represented as a string

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Review Sentences

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{polarities}} \textendash{} Polarities associated to the review, that can come from directly from the source file for polarity label
datasets, or from the result of different analysis. Each polarity can be identified with its analysis attribute.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\index{review\_str() (loacore.classes.classes.Review method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review.review_str}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{review\_str}}}{\emph{colored\_polarity=True}, \emph{analysis={[}{]}}}{}~\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{colored\_polarity}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, polarities are colored printed.
(red = Negative, green = Positive, yellow = Objective, black = No Synset)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{analysis}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The polarities computed with the specified analysis will be added at the end of each review.

\end{itemize}

Review string representation

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
string

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{compute\_freeling\_sentence() (loacore.classes.classes.Sentence method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence.compute_freeling_sentence}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_freeling\_sentence}}}{}{}~\begin{quote}

Generates a basic \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.sentence}} instance, converting \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{words}} as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.word}} .
\end{quote}

This function is used to process {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}} with Freeling.
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load sentences from database and convert them into Freeling Sentences.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{loacore}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{load}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{sentence\PYGZus{}load} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{sentence\PYGZus{}load}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{sentences} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sentence\PYGZus{}load}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{load\PYGZus{}sentences}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{freeling\PYGZus{}sentences} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{compute\PYGZus{}freeling\PYGZus{}sentence}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{sentences}\PYG{p}{]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item[{return}] \leavevmode
generated Freeling Sentence instance

\item[{rtype}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.sentence}}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{itemize}

\index{colored\_word() (loacore.classes.classes.Word method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Word.colored_word}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{colored\_word}}}{}{}
Colored representation of word. If a Synset is associated, colored are assigned as follow :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
pos\_score \textgreater{} neg\_score =\textgreater{} red

\item {} 
neg\_score \textgreater{} pos\_score =\textgreater{} green

\item {} 
neg\_score = pos\_score =\textgreater{} yellow

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Colored word

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
string

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{compute\_freeling\_word() (loacore.classes.classes.Word method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Word.compute_freeling_word}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_freeling\_word}}}{}{}
Generates a basic \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.word}} instance, generated by only the word form, even if some analysis
could have already been realized.

Moreover, only \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.classes.classes.File.load\_sentence()}} (that itself uses this function) should be used,
because all Freeling analysis work with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pyfreeling.sentence}} instances.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
neg\_score + pos\_score + obj\_score = 1
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{Feeding database : \sphinxstyleemphasis{process} package}
\label{\detokenize{process:feeding-database-process-package}}\label{\detokenize{process::doc}}
This package contains all the necessary modules to perform the process of new files. Notice that all the processes are automatically handled by the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.


\section{Raw Processes}
\label{\detokenize{process:raw-processes}}

\subsection{Normalization and review splitting}
\label{\detokenize{process:normalization-and-review-splitting}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Normalization : conversion to UTF-8 and lower case

\item {} 
Review splitting : the file text is splitted into reviews

\end{itemize}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:module-loacore.process.review_process}}\index{loacore.process.review\_process (module)}\index{add\_reviews\_from\_files() (in module loacore.process.review\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.review_process.add_reviews_from_files}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.review\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_reviews\_from\_files}}}{\emph{files}, \emph{encoding}}{}
Load argument files from file system and normalize their content.

Compute Reviews objects and add them to the database.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the {\hyperref[\detokenize{process:loacore.process.file_process.add_files}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_files()}}}}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{encoding}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Encoding used to load files.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
added reviews

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{normalize() (in module loacore.process.review\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.review_process.normalize}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.review\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{normalize}}}{\emph{text}}{}
Performs raw text normalization.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Conversion to lower case

\item {} 
Review splitting using python regular expressions : each new line correspond to a new review

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Freeling Processes}
\label{\detokenize{process:freeling-processes}}

\subsection{tokenization}
\label{\detokenize{process:module-loacore.process.sentence_process}}\label{\detokenize{process:tokenization}}\index{loacore.process.sentence\_process (module)}\index{add\_sentences\_from\_reviews() (in module loacore.process.sentence\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.sentence_process.add_sentences_from_reviews}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.sentence\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_sentences\_from\_reviews}}}{\emph{reviews}, \emph{\_state\_queue=None}, \emph{\_id\_process=None}, \emph{freeling\_modules=None}}{}
Performs the first Freeling process applied to each normalized review.

Each review is tokenized, and then splitted into sentences, thanks to corresponding Freeling modules.

A representation of the Sentences and their Words (tokens) are then added to corresponding tables.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}) \textendash{} Reviews to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
added sentences

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{lemmatization}
\label{\detokenize{process:module-loacore.process.lemma_process}}\label{\detokenize{process:lemmatization}}\index{loacore.process.lemma\_process (module)}\index{add\_lemmas\_to\_sentences() (in module loacore.process.lemma\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.lemma_process.add_lemmas_to_sentences}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.lemma\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_lemmas\_to\_sentences}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{print\_lemmas=False}, \emph{\_state\_queue=None}, \emph{\_id\_process=None}, \emph{freeling\_modules=None}}{}
Performs a Freeling process to add lemmas to words.

However, the argument is actually a sentence to better fit Freeling usage.

Our sentences will be converted to a Freeling Sentences before processing.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_lemmas}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, print lemmatization results

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{disambiguation}
\label{\detokenize{process:module-loacore.process.synset_process}}\label{\detokenize{process:disambiguation}}\index{loacore.process.synset\_process (module)}\index{add\_polarity\_to\_synsets() (in module loacore.process.synset\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.synset_process.add_polarity_to_synsets}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.synset\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_polarity\_to\_synsets}}}{\emph{id\_words}, \emph{\_state\_queue=None}, \emph{\_id\_process=None}}{}
Adds the positive/negative/objective polarities of all the synsets currently in the table
Synset, from the SentiWordNet corpus.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{add\_synsets\_to\_sentences() (in module loacore.process.synset\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.synset_process.add_synsets_to_sentences}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.synset\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_synsets\_to\_sentences}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{print\_synsets=False}, \emph{\_state\_queue=None}, \emph{\_id\_process=None}, \emph{freeling\_modules=None}}{}
Performs a Freeling process to disambiguate words of the sentences according to their context
(UKB algorithm) linking them to a unique synset (if possible).

Our sentences are converted to Freeling Sentences before processing.

Notice that even if we may have already computed the Lemmas for example, Freeling Sentences generated from our
sentences are “raw sentences”, without any analysis linked to their Words. So we make all the Freeling
process from scratch every time, except \sphinxstyleemphasis{tokenization} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{sentence splitting}, to avoid any confusion.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the file\_process.add\_files() function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_synsets}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, print disambiguation results

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{dependency tree generation}
\label{\detokenize{process:module-loacore.process.deptree_process}}\label{\detokenize{process:dependency-tree-generation}}\index{loacore.process.deptree\_process (module)}\index{add\_dep\_tree\_from\_sentences() (in module loacore.process.deptree\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.deptree_process.add_dep_tree_from_sentences}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.deptree\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_dep\_tree\_from\_sentences}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{print\_result=False}, \emph{\_state\_queue=None}, \emph{\_id\_process=None}, \emph{freeling\_modules=None}}{}
Generates the dependency trees of the specified sentences and add the results to the
database.

Sentences are firstly converted into “raw” Freeling sentences (without any analysis) and then all the necessary
Freeling processes are performed.

The PoS\_tag of words are also computed and added to the database in this function.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function should be used only inside the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_process.add\_files()}} function.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This process can be quite long. (at least a few minutes)
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{print\_result}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Print PoS\_tags and labels associated to each {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Word}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Word}}}}}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\section{Feed database}
\label{\detokenize{process:module-loacore.process.file_process}}\label{\detokenize{process:feed-database}}\index{loacore.process.file\_process (module)}\index{add\_files() (in module loacore.process.file\_process)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{process:loacore.process.file_process.add_files}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.process.file\_process.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_files}}}{\emph{file\_paths}, \emph{encoding='utf8'}, \emph{lang=''}, \emph{workers=1}}{}
This function performs the full process on all the file\_paths specified, and add the results to the corresponding
tables.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_paths}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html\#term-path-like-object}{path-like object}) \textendash{} Paths used to load files

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{encoding}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Files encoding.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lang}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} 
If specify, \sphinxstyleemphasis{lang} will be used as Freeling language.
Otherwise, default language is used (See \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore}})

Possible values : ‘as’, ‘ca’, ‘cs’, ‘cy’, ‘de’, ‘en’, ‘es’, ‘fr’, ‘gl’, ‘hr’, ‘it’, ‘nb’, ‘pt’, ‘ru’, ‘sl’)

See \sphinxurl{https://talp-upc.gitbooks.io/freeling-4-1-user-manual/content/basics.html} for more details.


\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{workers}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} 
Number of workers used to perform Freeling processes.

If \sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} \textless{}= 0, Multiprocessing is not used and all the programm is run in a unique process.

if \sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} \textgreater{} 0, \sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} processes are created in addition of the main process. This is useful to take
advantage of multi-core architectures to greatly speed up the process.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
To control the state of each process when \sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} \textgreater{} 0, a Python curses app is opened. Notice that
seems to work badly in PyCharm terminal.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\end{itemize}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
\end{description}\end{quote}

Process and load file from the relative directory \sphinxstyleemphasis{data/raw/}

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{file\PYGZus{}paths} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{dirpath}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{dirnames}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{filenames} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{os}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{walk}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{os}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{path}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{join}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{data}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{raw}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{name} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{filenames}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{file\PYGZus{}paths}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{os}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{path}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{join}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{dirpath}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{name}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\section{Load Files}
\label{\detokenize{load:module-loacore.load.file_load}}\label{\detokenize{load:load-files}}\index{loacore.load.file\_load (module)}\index{clean\_db() (in module loacore.load.file\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{load:loacore.load.file_load.clean_db}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.file\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{clean\_db}}}{}{}
Remove all files from database. Implemented references will also engender the deletion of all files
dependencies in database : all the tables will be emptied.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_id\_files\_by\_file\_path() (in module loacore.load.file\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{load:loacore.load.file_load.get_id_files_by_file_path}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.file\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_id\_files\_by\_file\_path}}}{\emph{file\_path\_re}}{}
This function can be used to retrieve file ids in database from their path.

For more information about how Python regular expressions work, see \sphinxurl{https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html} .
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_path\_re}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Regular expression to check

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Ids of matching files.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
\end{description}\end{quote}

Find if files of files in an uci folder.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{loacore}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{load}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{file\PYGZus{}load} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{file\PYGZus{}load}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{ids} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{file\PYGZus{}load}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get\PYGZus{}id\PYGZus{}files\PYGZus{}by\PYGZus{}file\PYGZus{}path}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{r}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{.*/uci/.+}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{ids}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{[1, 2, 3]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
The full path of a file (as saved in the database) can be used as a regular expression.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{load\_database() (in module loacore.load.file\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{load:loacore.load.file_load.load_database}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.file\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_database}}}{\emph{id\_files={[}{]}}, \emph{load\_reviews=True}, \emph{load\_polarities=True}, \emph{load\_sentences=True}, \emph{load\_words=True}, \emph{load\_deptrees=True}, \emph{workers=1}}{}
Load the complete database as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}} , with all the dependencies specified in parameters
loaded in them.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{id\_files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} If specified, load only the files with the corresponding ids. Otherwise, load all the files.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_reviews}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} Specify if Reviews need to be loaded if files.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_polarities}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If Reviews have been loaded, specify if Polarities need to be loaded in reviews.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_sentences}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If Reviews have been loaded, specify if Sentences need to be loaded in reviews.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_words}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If Sentences have been loaded, specify if Words need to be loaded in sentences.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_deptrees}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}) \textendash{} If Words have been loaded, specify if DepTrees need to be loaded in sentences.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{workers}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} 
Number of workers used to load database.

If \sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} \textless{}= 0, Multiprocessing is not used and all the program is run in a unique process.

if \sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} \textgreater{} 0, \sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} processes are created in addition of the main process. This is useful to take
advantage of multi-core architectures to greatly speed up the process.


\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
loaded files

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Among the dependencies, only the load\_deptrees should be set to False to significantly reduce processing
time if they are not needed. Loading other structures is quite fast.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load files 1,2,3 with only their \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{id\_file}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{id\_path}}.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\index{load\_reviews\_in\_files() (in module loacore.load.review\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{load:loacore.load.review_load.load_reviews_in_files}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.review\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_reviews\_in\_files}}}{\emph{files}, \emph{load\_sentences=False}, \emph{load\_words=False}, \emph{load\_deptrees=False}}{}
Load reviews into corresponding \sphinxstyleemphasis{files}, setting up their attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{reviews}}.

Also return all the loaded reviews.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function is automatically called by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_load.load\_database()}} when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_reviews} is set to
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}. In most of the cases, this function should be used to load files and reviews in one go.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files in which corresponding reviews will be loaded.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_sentences}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if Sentences need to be loaded in reviews.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_words}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If Sentences have been loaded, specify if Words need to be loaded in sentences.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_deptrees}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If Words have been loaded, specify if DepTrees need to be loaded in sentences.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Loaded reviews

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{load\_sentences\_in\_reviews() (in module loacore.load.sentence\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Load sentences into corresponding \sphinxstyleemphasis{reviews}, setting up their attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sentences}}.

Also return all the loaded sentences.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function is automatically called by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_load.load\_database()}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{review\_load.load\_reviews()}}
when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_sentences} is set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}.
In most of the cases, those functions should be used instead to load reviews and sentences in one go.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}) \textendash{} Reviews in which corresponding sentences should be loaded.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_words}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if Words need to be loaded in sentences.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_deptrees}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If Words have been loaded, specify if DepTrees need to be loaded in sentences.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Loaded sentences

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{load\_words\_in\_dep\_trees() (in module loacore.load.word\_load)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{load:loacore.load.word_load.load_words_in_dep_trees}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.load.word\_load.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{load\_words\_in\_dep\_trees}}}{\emph{dep\_trees}, \emph{load\_lemmas=True}, \emph{load\_synsets=True}}{}
Load words into corresponding \sphinxstyleemphasis{dep\_trees}, setting up the attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{word}} of each node.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function is automatically called by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_load.load\_database()}} when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_deptrees} is set to
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}, or by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dep\_tree.load\_deptrees()}} when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_words} is set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}.
In most of the cases, those functions should be used instead to load dep\_trees and words in one go.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_lemmas}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if Lemmas need to be loaded in words.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{load\_synsets}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if Synsets need to be loaded in words.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Load Dep Trees into corresponding \sphinxstyleemphasis{sentences}, setting up their attribute \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dep\_tree}}.

Also return all the loaded deptrees.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This function is automatically called by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file\_load.load\_database()}} or
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sentence\_load.load\_sentences()}} when \sphinxstyleemphasis{load\_deptrees} is set to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}.
In most of the cases, those functions should be used instead to load sentences and deptrees in one go.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\section{Sentiment Analysis}
\label{\detokenize{analysis:module-loacore.analysis.sentiment_analysis}}\label{\detokenize{analysis:sentiment-analysis}}\index{loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis (module)}\index{compute\_extreme\_files\_polarity() (in module loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.sentiment_analysis.compute_extreme_files_polarity}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_extreme\_files\_polarity}}}{\emph{files}, \emph{pessimistic=False}, \emph{freeling\_lang='es'}}{}
Compute the extreme polarity of all the reviews in each file, and then compute the normalized sum of polarities of
all reviews of each file, and return them as a dictionary that map id\_files to polarity tuples (pos\_score,
neg\_score, obj\_score).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pessimistic}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if pessimistic computing should be used. Optimistic is used if set to False.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Score dictionary

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode

\index{compute\_extreme\_reviews\_polarity() (in module loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.sentiment_analysis.compute_extreme_reviews_polarity}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_extreme\_reviews\_polarity}}}{\emph{reviews}, \emph{commit\_polarities=False}, \emph{pessimistic=False}, \emph{freeling\_lang='es'}}{}
Performs \sphinxstyleemphasis{extreme} reviews polarity computation : only the most pessimistic or optimistic sense
(according to pessimistic argument) is considered. Those values tend to show how the disambiguation process is
important, due to the huge difference between pessimistic and optimistic scores.

Also notice that this function is an interesting example of how other processes could be applied to data already
computed in database. Here, the disambiguated synsets are not used, and all senses re-computed with Freeling are
used.

Check source code for more detailed explanations about this example.

Polarities are then stored in reviews, with the analysis label ‘optimistic’ or ‘pessimistic’ according to
\sphinxstyleemphasis{pessimistic} parameter, and eventually committed to database if \sphinxstyleemphasis{commit\_polarities} is set to True.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}) \textendash{} Reviews to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{commit\_polarities}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If set to True, computed polarities are commited to database.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pessimistic}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if pessimistic computing should be used. Optimistic is used if set to False.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{freeling\_lang}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{String}}) \textendash{} 
Specify language used by Freeling. Default : ‘es’.

Possible values : ‘as’, ‘ca’, ‘cs’, ‘cy’, ‘de’, ‘en’, ‘es’, ‘fr’, ‘gl’, ‘hr’, ‘it’, ‘nb’, ‘pt’, ‘ru’, ‘sl’)

See \sphinxurl{https://talp-upc.gitbooks.io/freeling-4-1-user-manual/content/basics.html} for more details.


\end{itemize}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Commit pessimistic polarities of uci files to database.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%

\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{loacore.load.review\PYGZus{}load} \PYG{k+kn}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{review\PYGZus{}load}

\PYG{n}{ids} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{file\PYGZus{}load}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get\PYGZus{}id\PYGZus{}files\PYGZus{}by\PYGZus{}file\PYGZus{}paths}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+sa}{r}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{.*/uci/.+}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}

                                                    \PYG{n}{freeling\PYGZus{}lang}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{en}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{compute\_simple\_files\_polarity() (in module loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.sentiment_analysis.compute_simple_files_polarity}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_simple\_files\_polarity}}}{\emph{files}}{}
Compute the simple polarity of all the reviews in each file, and then compute the normalized sum of polarities of
all reviews of each file, and return them as a dictionary that map id\_files to polarity tuples (pos\_score,
neg\_score, obj\_score).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Polarity dict

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load uci files, compute basic polarities, and show results with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{utils.print\_polarity\_table()}}.

\index{compute\_simple\_reviews\_polarity() (in module loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.sentiment_analysis.compute_simple_reviews_polarity}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.sentiment\_analysis.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_simple\_reviews\_polarity}}}{\emph{reviews}, \emph{commit\_polarities=False}}{}
Perform the easiest sentiment analysis possible : a normalized sum of the positive/negative/objective polarities
available in all synsets of each review, setting the polarity in the review.polarities dict, with the entry “simple”.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Commit simple polarities of uci files to database.

\section{Pattern Recognition}
\label{\detokenize{analysis:module-loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition}}\label{\detokenize{analysis:pattern-recognition}}\index{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition (module)}
Patterns recognitions are realized on the dependency trees computed with Freeling. This means that \sphinxstyleemphasis{parent-child}
structures will be matched, what \sphinxstylestrong{don’t necessarily correspond to adjacent words in the original sentence}.
\index{adj\_pattern\_table() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.adj_pattern_table}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{adj\_pattern\_table}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{polarity\_commuter\_only=True}, \emph{lang='en'}}{}
Return a string table with the following fiels :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Noun : word with a Noun PoS\_tag, with an associated adjective

\item {} 
N\_Polarity + : noun positive polarity

\item {} 
N\_Polatity - : noun negative polarity

\item {} 
Adj : word with an Adjective PoS\_tag, associated to the Noun according to the sentence dependency tree

\item {} 
A\_Polarity + : adjective positive polarity

\item {} 
A\_Polarity - : adjective negative polarity

\end{itemize}

Only the words associated to a synset are considered.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{polarity\_commuter\_only}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, only the patterns that are subject to a polarity commutation are displayed, i.e. those constituted by a
positive noun associated to a negative adjective.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lang}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} Language used. (PoS\_tags and dependency labels to match are chosen accordingly) Possible values : ‘en’, ‘es’

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Table as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
string

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load Spanish files from corrected folder (previously added to database) and print their adj pattern table, with
polarity commutation only.

\index{general\_pattern\_recognition() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.general_pattern_recognition}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{general\_pattern\_recognition}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{pattern}, \emph{types}}{}
Recognize a general pattern, compound of PoS\_tags and dependency labels, in the DepTrees associated to specified
sentences.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} A 2 dimensional list of strings representing patterns. The patterns list pattern{[}i{]} represents the label
that will match at position i. ex : \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern = {[}{[}‘V’{]}, {[}‘cc’, ‘ci’, ‘cd’{]}{]}} will match all the
\sphinxstyleemphasis{Verb/complement} structures.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{types}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}. Allowed value are ‘PoS\_tag’ and ‘label’. Otherwise, nothing will
match.) \textendash{} Specify what type of match to use, such that \sphinxstyleemphasis{types{[}i{]}} specifies if elements of \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern{[}i{]}} have to be
condidered as PoS\_tag or label. Notice that types is unidimensional, whereas pattern can be 2 dimensional :
this means that for consistency reason, we assume that all the tags that can match in a position \sphinxstyleemphasis{i} are of
the same nature.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Matching patterns in specified sentences, as node tuples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.DepTreeNode}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DepTreeNode}}}}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Find all the Verb(PoS\_tag)/complement(label) patterns in file 28(\_PQRS.txt).

(classically, a negation that applies to the parent verb)

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%

\index{label\_patterns\_recognition() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.label_patterns_recognition}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{label\_patterns\_recognition}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{pattern}}{}
Recognize a dependency label pattern in the DepTrees associated to specified sentences.

Labels used for Spanish can be found there :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxurl{http://clic.ub.edu/corpus/webfm\_send/20}

\item {} 
\sphinxurl{http://clic.ub.edu/corpus/webfm\_send/18}

\item {} 
\sphinxurl{http://clic.ub.edu/corpus/webfm\_send/49}

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} A 2 dimensional list of strings representing patterns. The patterns list pattern{[}i{]} represents the label that
will match at position i. ex : \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern = {[}{[}‘sentence’, ‘v’{]}, {[}‘}’{]}{]}* could be used to find all the dependency
functions that could follow \sphinxstyleemphasis{sentence} of \sphinxstyleemphasis{v} function.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Matching patterns in specified sentences, as node tuples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.DepTreeNode}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DepTreeNode}}}}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Find all node to which a verbal modifier is applied in file 28 (\_PQRS.txt).

(classically, a negation that applies to the parent verb)

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\index{pos\_tag\_patterns\_recognition() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.pos_tag_patterns_recognition}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{pos\_tag\_patterns\_recognition}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{pattern}}{}
Recognize a PoS\_tag pattern in the DepTrees associated to specified sentences.

PoS\_tags corresponding to each language can be found there :
\sphinxurl{https://talp-upc.gitbooks.io/freeling-4-1-user-manual/content/tagsets.html}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pattern}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} 
A 2 dimensional list of strings representing patterns. The patterns list pattern{[}i{]} represents the PoS\_tags that
will match at position i. ex : \sphinxstyleemphasis{pattern = {[}{[}‘V’{]}, {[}‘A’, ‘NC’{]}{]}} recognizes verbs followed by an adjective or a
common noun.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Matches are performed with the beginning of the PoS\_tag, according to the length of the specified
tags. For example, ‘A’ will match ‘AQ0CS00’, ‘AQ0MS00’…
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Matching patterns in specified sentences, as node tuples.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.DepTreeNode}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DepTreeNode}}}}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Find all Noun/Adjective patterns in file 28 (\_PQRS.txt).

\index{verb\_context\_table() (in module loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.pattern_recognition.verb_context_table}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.pattern\_recognition.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{verb\_context\_table}}}{\emph{sentences}, \emph{context\_length=2}}{}
Return a string table with the following fields :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Verb : a word with a verb PoS\_tag

\item {} 
Context : the context of the words. \sphinxstyleemphasis{context\_length} defines the number of words to display before and after
the verb.

\item {} 
synset : name of the synset associated to the verb

\item {} 
polarity + : positive polarity

\item {} 
polarity - : negative polarity

\item {} 
polarity = : objective polarity

\end{itemize}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sentences}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Sentence}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Sentence}}}}}) \textendash{} Sentences to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{context\_length}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number of words to display before and after the verb.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Table as a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
string

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Load files from uci and corrected folders (after they have been added to database) and print their verb context
tables.

\section{Frequencies}
\label{\detokenize{analysis:frequencies}}
This module provides functions to compute simple and bigram dependency labels frequencies. The objective of such analysis could be to identify relevant structures among the most commons.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:module-loacore.analysis.frequencies}}\index{loacore.analysis.frequencies (module)}\index{bigram\_label\_frequencies() (in module loacore.analysis.frequencies)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.frequencies.bigram_label_frequencies}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.frequencies.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{bigram\_label\_frequencies}}}{\emph{files}}{}
Compute bigram dependency label frequencies if files.

A “bigram label” is defined as a tuple constituted by the label of a parent node, and the label of one of its
children.

Results are returned in a dictionary that map file names to frequencies.

Frequencies are represented has dictionaries that map dependency labels to frequencies.

A list of dependency labels is also returns.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Dependency labels, and a dictionary that maps file names to frequencies

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} , \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Compute bigram label frequencies of uci files.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{bigram\_pos\_tag\_frequencies() (in module loacore.analysis.frequencies)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.frequencies.bigram_pos_tag_frequencies}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.frequencies.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{bigram\_pos\_tag\_frequencies}}}{\emph{files}, \emph{tag\_len=2}}{}
Same idea as :func:{\color{red}\bfseries{}{}`}label\_frequencies’, but with Part Of Speech tags.

The number of characters of the PoS\_tags to consider can be specified with tag\_len.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tag\_len}} \textendash{} Number of letters kept in each PoS\_tag

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tag\_len}} \textendash{} int

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
PoS\_tags, and a dictionary that maps file names to frequencies

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} , \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Compute bigram PoS\_tags frequencies of uci files.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{count\_bigram\_label() (in module loacore.analysis.frequencies)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.frequencies.count_bigram_label}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.frequencies.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{count\_bigram\_label}}}{\emph{file}, \emph{bigram\_label}, \emph{c}}{}
Count the number of occurrence of \sphinxstyleemphasis{bigram\_label} if all the dependency trees of \sphinxstyleemphasis{file}, through an SQL request.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
For a more efficient call from {\hyperref[\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.frequencies.bigram_label_frequencies}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bigram\_label\_frequencies()}}}}}, this function takes an already initialized SQL
cursor as an argument.
If you want to use it, you can initialize \sphinxstyleemphasis{c} with the following code :

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{sqlite3} \PYG{k+kn}{as} \PYG{n+nn}{sql}
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{loacore.conf} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{DB\PYGZus{}PATH}
\PYG{n}{conn} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sql}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{connect}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{DB\PYGZus{}PATH}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{c} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{conn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{cursor}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\index{get\_bigram\_label\_set() (in module loacore.analysis.frequencies)}

Returns all the existing bigram dependency labels in files, through a SQL request.

A “bigram label” is defined as a tuple constituted by the label of a parent node, and the label of one of its
children.

For a more efficient call from {\hyperref[\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.frequencies.bigram_label_frequencies}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bigram\_label\_frequencies()}}}}}, this function takes an already initialized SQL

\PYG{n}{conn} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sql}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{connect}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{DB\PYGZus{}PATH}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{c} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{conn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{cursor}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\index{label\_frequencies() (in module loacore.analysis.frequencies)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.frequencies.label_frequencies}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.frequencies.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{label\_frequencies}}}{\emph{files}}{}
Compute simple dependency label frequencies if files.

Results are returned in a dictionary that map file names to frequencies.

Frequencies are represented has dictionaries that map dependency labels to frequencies.

A list of dependency labels is also returns.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Dependency labels, and a dictionary that maps file names to frequencies

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} , \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Compute simple label frequencies of uci files.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{polarity\_word\_label\_frequencies() (in module loacore.analysis.frequencies)}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\section{Polarity Check}
\label{\detokenize{analysis:polarity-check}}
This modules provides functions to compare results of polarity analysis. Comparation with the analysis that correspond to labelled reviews can notably be used to detect/show/count false positive and false negative of other analysis.

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:module-loacore.analysis.polarity_check}}\index{loacore.analysis.polarity\_check (module)}\index{check\_polarity() (in module loacore.analysis.polarity\_check)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.polarity_check.check_polarity}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.polarity\_check.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{check\_polarity}}}{\emph{files, analysis\_to\_check={[}'simple', 'optimistic', 'pessimistic', 'pattern\_adj\_cc', 'pattern\_adj', 'pattern\_cc'{]}, ref='label'}}{}
Prints tables with the rates, in percentages, of correct, false positive and false negative classifications of
reviews by file for each analysis in \sphinxstyleemphasis{analysis\_to\_check}, compared with \sphinxstyleemphasis{ref} analysis.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{analysis\_to\_check}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Analysis to check

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ref}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} Reference analysis, with which analysis to check are compared.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{write\_polarity\_check() (in module loacore.analysis.polarity\_check)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{analysis:loacore.analysis.polarity_check.write_polarity_check}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.polarity\_check.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{write\_polarity\_check}}}{\emph{files, analysis\_to\_check={[}'simple', 'optimistic', 'pessimistic', 'pattern\_adj\_cc', 'pattern\_adj', 'pattern\_cc'{]}, ref='label', select='all', terminal\_print=True, colored\_polarity=True, directory\_path='/home/paulbreugnot/Development/Python/workspace/Loacore/results/sentiment\_analysis/check'}}{}
Write polarity in .txt files. If \sphinxstyleemphasis{select} is set to all, each review is written with polarities corresponding to
\sphinxstyleemphasis{ref} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{analysis\_to\_check}. If \sphinxstyleemphasis{select} is set to \sphinxstyleemphasis{false\_positive} or \sphinxstyleemphasis{false\_negative}, only the review with a
false positive or false negative for at least one analysis of \sphinxstyleemphasis{analysis\_to\_check} are written, with the
corresponding(s) polarities.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.File}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{File}}}}}) \textendash{} Files to process.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{analysis\_to\_check}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Analysis to compare with \sphinxstyleemphasis{ref}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ref}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} Reference analysis

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{select}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \{‘all’, ‘false\_positive’, ‘false\_negative’\}) \textendash{} Select option

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{terminal\_print}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, print results in the terminal.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{colored\_polarity}} \textendash{} 
If True, write words with colored polarity. Notice that colors are not display in most of the .txt editors.
For example, in Linux, use
\begin{quote}

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
cat file\PYGZus{}name.txt
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

To show the colored file in terminal.


\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{directory\_path}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html\#term-path-like-object}{path-like object}) \textendash{} Path of the directory in which to write files.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Word2Vec}

\section{Latent Semantic Indexing}
\label{\detokenize{learning:module-loacore.learning.lsi}}\label{\detokenize{learning:latent-semantic-indexing}}\index{loacore.learning.lsi (module)}\index{lsi\_model() (in module loacore.learning.lsi)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{learning:loacore.learning.lsi.lsi_model}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.learning.lsi.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{lsi\_model}}}{\emph{reviews}}{}
Train a Latent Semantic Indexing model from input \sphinxstyleemphasis{reviews}, with
\sphinxhref{https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/models/lsimodel.html}{gensim.models.LsiModel}.

During the process, a vocabulary and a dictionary mapping this vocabulary to unique integers
(because \sphinxhref{https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/models/lsimodel.html\#gensim.models.lsimodel.LsiModel}{LsiModel}
use this representation of texts) is computed from input \sphinxstyleemphasis{reviews}, and this dictionary is also returned.

To compute vocabulary, word lemmas are considered if defines, otherwise word forms are used.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}) \textendash{} Input reviews.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A dictionary mapping vocabulary to integers, and the trained LSI model.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{string}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}},
\sphinxhref{https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/models/lsimodel.html\#gensim.models.lsimodel.LsiModel}{LsiModel}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{review\_2\_vec() (in module loacore.learning.lsi)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{learning:loacore.learning.lsi.review_2_vec}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.learning.lsi.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{review\_2\_vec}}}{\emph{review}, \emph{model}, \emph{word2int\_dict}}{}
Return a vector representation of \sphinxstyleemphasis{review} according to the given model.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxstyleemphasis{word2int\_dict} should be consistent with \sphinxstyleemphasis{model}, i.e. \sphinxstyleemphasis{word2int\_dict} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{model} should be the results of
the same call of {\hyperref[\detokenize{learning:loacore.learning.lsi.lsi_model}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lsi\_model()}}}}}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{review}} \textendash{} Input review

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{review}} \textendash{} {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} \textendash{} Trained LsiModel

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{word2int\_dict}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{string}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} A dictionary mapping vocabulary to integers.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A vector representation of \sphinxstyleemphasis{review}, according to \sphinxstyleemphasis{model}.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode

\sphinxhref{https://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy-1.14.0/reference/generated/numpy.array.html}{numpy.array}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{reviews\_2\_vec() (in module loacore.learning.lsi)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{learning:loacore.learning.lsi.reviews_2_vec}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.learning.lsi.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{reviews\_2\_vec}}}{\emph{reviews}, \emph{model}, \emph{word2int\_dict}}{}

\section{SVM}

\index{get\_labels\_vector() (in module loacore.learning.svm)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{learning:loacore.learning.svm.get_labels_vector}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.learning.svm.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_labels\_vector}}}{\emph{reviews}, \emph{ref='label'}}{}
Return reviews classification based on specified ref analysis. Classes are represented as -1, 0, +1, according to
the results of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Polarity}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Polarity}}}}} fucntions :
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Polarity.is_negative}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_negative()}}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Polarity.is_objective}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_objective()}}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Polarity.is_positive}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_positive()}}}}}

\end{itemize}

Especially used with reviews as the learning dataset, to return labels to give to the LinearSVC learning model.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}) \textendash{} Reviews to process

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ref}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} Reference analysis

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Reviews classification

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{Validation}
\label{\detokenize{learning:module-loacore.learning.validation}}\label{\detokenize{learning:validation}}\index{loacore.learning.validation (module)}\index{k\_fold\_validation() (in module loacore.learning.validation)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{learning:loacore.learning.validation.k_fold_validation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.learning.validation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{k\_fold\_validation}}}{\emph{reviews}, \emph{reviews\_vectors}, \emph{k}}{}
Performs a K-Fold validation from \sphinxstyleemphasis{reviews} and their associated vector representation using sklearn function
\sphinxhref{http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.model\_selection.cross\_val\_score.html\#sklearn.model\_selection.cross\_val\_score}{cross\_val\_score}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}} of {\hyperref[\detokenize{classes:loacore.classes.classes.Review}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Review}}}}}) \textendash{} Reviews to check.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{reviews\_vectors}} \textendash{} Vectors representations associated to reviews.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{k}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} K-Fold model parameter

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
Cross validation results.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode

array-like object, as returned by \sphinxhref{http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.model\_selection.cross\_val\_score.html\#sklearn.model\_selection.cross\_val\_score}{cross\_val\_score}.


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{utils:module-loacore.utils.print_patterns}}\index{loacore.utils.print\_patterns (module)}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{utils:module-loacore.utils.plot_frequencies}}\index{loacore.utils.plot\_frequencies (module)}\index{frequencies\_bar\_chart() (in module loacore.utils.plot\_frequencies)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{utils:loacore.utils.plot_frequencies.frequencies_bar_chart}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.utils.plot\_frequencies.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{frequencies\_bar\_chart}}}{\emph{files\_frequencies}, \emph{plot=False}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{gui=False}, \emph{file\_path='/home/paulbreugnot/Development/Python/workspace/Loacore/results/frequencies'}, \emph{file\_name='frequencies\_bar\_chart.pdf'}, \emph{val\_number=0}}{}
This function allows to plot or save results of {\hyperref[\detokenize{analysis:module-loacore.analysis.frequencies}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{loacore.analysis.frequencies}}}}}.

If plot is set to True, results will be presented in a matplotlib figure, but \sphinxstyleemphasis{save} will be set to False.
(matplotlib restriction)

Notice that all the results are arbitrarily re-ordered in the order of the first file of files\_frequencies. This
means for example that the right-most label of the graph corresponds to the most common of the first file, but that
is not necessarily true for the others. This could also be useful to consider when \sphinxstyleemphasis{val\_number} is used to show only
“interesting” labels. Those labels actually correspond to the \sphinxstyleemphasis{val\_number} most common labels of the first file.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files\_frequencies}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}} of label : \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{float}} .) \textendash{} Dictionary that maps file names to frequencies.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plot}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If True, plot results as a figure.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{save}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} If not \sphinxstyleemphasis{plot}, save figure as a PDF.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{gui}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} Specify if a GUI should be used to set directory.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_path}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html\#term-path-like-object}{path-like object}) \textendash{} 
Path of the directory used.

Default : ‘RESULT\_PATH/frequencies/’


\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} File name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{val\_number}} \textendash{} Number of labels to show. Only the most commons in the first file will be kept.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Example}] \leavevmode
Save the 60 most commons bigram labels frequencies of uci files in a PDF.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%

\chapter{Other Useful Examples}
\label{\detokenize{other_examples:other-useful-examples}}\label{\detokenize{other_examples::doc}}
Display dependency trees from node that have at least one adjective as a child, from all the database file.

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
